data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound synthesized using Fe(BF4)·6H2O and chloranilic acid in DMF?
data.answer: C40H62Cl6Fe2N8O20

data.question: What is the crystal system and space group of the compound (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: Trigonal, P–31m

data.question: What is the BET surface area of the activated compound derived from (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
What change in magnetic ordering temperature occurs upon activation of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: The magnetic ordering temperature changes from 80 to 26 K upon activation.

data.question: True or False: The compound (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF exhibits a higher magnetic ordering temperature before activation.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: DMF acts as a solvent in the synthesis process.

data.question: How is the activated form of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF, referred to as 1a, obtained?
data.answer: By soaking in THF and then heating at 120 °C under reduced pressure.

data.question: True or False: The activated form of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF has a lower BET surface area than its solvated form.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the Mössbauer spectra collected for (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: The Mössbauer spectra confirm the presence of high-spin FeIII centers.

data.question: True or False: The structural distortion observed in the activated form of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF is irreversible.
data.answer: False

data.question: What experimental technique is used to confirm the permanent microporosity of the activated compound derived from (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: N2 adsorption data collected at 77 K.

data.question: How does the magnetic behavior of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF change upon desolvation?
data.answer: The magnetic behavior changes from spontaneous magnetization below 80 K in the solvated form to below 26 K in the activated form.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF involves a spontaneous electron transfer from FeII to L2–.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of THF in the activation process of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: THF is used to desolvate the compound during the activation process.

data.question: What is the effect of solvent-induced switching on the magnetic ordering temperature of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: Solvent-induced switching results in a decrease in the magnetic ordering temperature from 80 K to 26 K.

data.question: True or False: The compound (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF retains its hexagonal plate-shaped crystal structure upon activation.
data.answer: True

data.question: What analytical technique is used to determine the presence of FeIII centers in (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: Mössbauer spectroscopy.

data.question: How does the removal of DMF and H2O solvent molecules affect the structure of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: The removal of solvent molecules causes a slight structural distortion and a decrease in magnetic ordering temperature.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF requires a high temperature of 130 °C.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the BET surface area measurement for the activated form of (Me2NH2)2[Fe2L3]·2H2O·6DMF?
data.answer: The BET surface area measurement confirms the presence of permanent microporosity in the activated compound.
